title: Rainy conditions in North, East, North-central to enhance from tomorrow
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that rainy conditions are expected to be temporarily enhanced over Eastern, Northern, North-central and Central provinces from tomorrow (18).

title: Final decision on electricity tariff revision today
byline: The Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) will issue its recommendation regarding the electricity tariffs revision for the next six months today (17).

title: Canadian teen missing after swept away by strong currents in Hikkaduwa
byline: Hikkaduwa Police have launched an investigation following the disappearance of a 19-year-old Canadian national tourist who was swept away by strong currents while swimming near the Hikkaduwa seashore on the evening of January 16, 2025.

title: A/L evaluation center closed following dispute over female teachers’ dress code
byline: The 2024 G.C.E. Advanced Level Examination evaluation centre established at the Pannipitiya Dharmapala Vidyala has temporarily been closed, owing to a dispute between the school principal and female teachers engaged in answer sheet evaluation activities with regard to their attire.

title: ‘Regulation, not destruction’: SLTDA calls for documentation of ‘illegal’ tourist accommodations
byline: The Chairman of Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) Buddhika Hewawasam assures that Sri Lanka possesses the necessary infrastructure to achieve the government’s target of attracting 3 million tourists to the island this year.

title: Driver killed, 15 foreigners injured in accident on Southern Expressway
byline: A coach carrying a group of foreign tourists has collided with a truck transporting cement, on the Southern Expressway, killing the bus driver and causing injuries to around 15 tourists this morning (17).

title: China pledges continued support for Sri Lanka’s sovereignty, territorial integrity and independence
byline: The Chairman of the Standing Committee of the National People’s Congress of China, Zhao Leji, has stated that China is committed to supporting Sri Lanka’s sovereignty, territorial integrity, and independence.

title: SJB appoints committee for discussions to work together with UNP
byline: The Working Committee of the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) has approved a proposal for discussions to work together with the United National Party (UNP).

title: Two 16-year-old boys killed in road accident in Nochchiyagama
byline: Two teenagers have reportedly died following a road accident in the Galadiwulwewa area of Nochchiyagama this evening (16).

title: Netanyahu says deal to release hostages held in Gaza has been reached
byline: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Friday a deal to return hostages held in the Gaza Strip has been reached, after his office had said earlier there were last minute snags in finalizing a ceasefire that would pause 15 months of war.

title: Driver killed, 19 foreigners injured in accident on Southern Expressway
byline: A coach carrying a group of foreign tourists has collided with a truck transporting cement, on the Southern Expressway, killing the bus driver and causing injuries to around 19 tourists this morning (17).

title: Sri Lanka CERT alerts on spike in scams through SMS and phone calls
byline: The Sri Lanka Computer Emergency Readiness Team (SL CERT) has issued a warning to the public regarding fraudulent text messages (SMS) and phone calls claiming to offer monetary rewards or prizes.

title: SpaceX Starship explodes after launch, forcing airlines to divert
byline: A SpaceX Starship rocket broke up in space minutes after launching from Texas on Thursday, forcing airline flights over the Gulf of Mexico to alter course to avoid falling debris and setting back Elon Musk’s flagship rocket program.

title: Ex-President Gotabaya summoned to CID
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has summoned former President Gotabaya Rajapaksa, for the recording of a statement regarding the ownership of a government-owned land in Kataragama.

title: Former Ambassador Udayanga Weeratunga granted bail
byline: Former Sri Lankan Ambassador to Russia, Udayanga Weeratunga, has been granted bail, after being produced before the Nugegoda Magistrate’s Court.

title: Exams Chief provides solution to dispute over dress code at A/L evaluation centre
byline: The Commissioner General of Examinations Amith Jayasundara said that the group of female teachers involved in a dispute over the dress code, who are currently engaged in the 2024 G.C.E. Advanced Level Examination answer sheet evaluation activities at the center established at Pannipitiya Dharmapala Vidyalaya...

title: Ex-President Gotabaya arrives at CID
byline: Former President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has arrived at the Criminal Investigation Department (CID), a short while ago.

title: Several trains cancelled as drivers prepare for promotion exam
byline: Train operations faced disruptions this morning (17) as approximately 10 train services were cancelled due to locomotive engine drivers preparing for a promotional examination.

title: Three Parliament employees found guilty of sexual harassment dismissed
byline: Three Parliament employees who were found guilty of sexually harassing female staff of Parliament have been dismissed from service, the Parliamentary Communications Department said.

title: Parliament to debate “Clean Sri Lanka” program next week
byline: The Secretary-General of Parliament, Mrs. Kushani Rohanadeera stated that Parliament is scheduled to convene next week from Tuesday (January 21) to Friday (January 24).

title: Manusha Nanayakkara’s brother granted bail
byline: Thisara Nanayakkara, the brother of former Foreign Employment Minister Manusha Nanayakkara, has been granted bail after being produced before the Gampaha Magistrate’s Court.

title: Pakistan court sentences ex-PM Imran Khan to 14 years in land graft case
byline: A Pakistani court sentenced former Prime Minister Imran Khan to 14 years imprisonment on Friday in a land corruption case, local broadcaster ARY News reported.
